isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - PERFORMANCE DIAGNOSTICS - Test Procedures - Crankcase Pressure

svcproc.title: Crankcase Pressure
svcproc.para: To measure the condition of the power cylinders

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the foreword of this manual. Follow all warnings, cautions, and notes.

step1.para: See Appendix A in this manual for specifications, and record on Performance Diagnostics form.
Make sure the engine oil level is not above full mark and the oil level gauge is secured.
Make sure breather tube is secure in valve cover and air inlet duct.
Clamp off recirculation tube with heater hose pliers.

figure.caption: Test line, crankcase breather tool, and gauge bar

step1.para: Install crankcase pressure test adapter to extended oil fill tube.

warning.para: To prevent serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:
When routing test line , do not crimp the line, run the line too close to moving parts, or let the line touch hot engine surfaces.

step1.para: Connect a line from the crankcase pressure test adapter to the magnehelic gauge on the gauge bar or a water magnahelic gage.

warning.para: To prevent serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:
When running the engine in the service bay, make sure the parking brake is set, the transmission is in neutral, and the wheels are blocked.

step1.para: Run engine to reach normal engine engine operating 70°C (158°F) before measuring crankcase pressure.
Run engine at high idle (no load) rpm. Allow the gauge reading to stabilize before taking the pressure reading.
Record crankcase pressure on diagnostics form.

item.para: If pressure is below spec, continue with Performance Diagnostics.
If pressure is above spec, continue with Step 11.

step1.para: If engine has an air compressor, remove air comprerssor drive belt and retest.

item.para: If pressure is below spec, repair or replace air compressor.
If pressure is above spec, continue with Step 12.

step1.para: Disconnect EVRT™ control valve and retest.

item.para: If pressure is below spec, reconnect EVRT™ control valve, and retest doing Test 20 (Air Management) to see if crankcase pressure increases as turbocharger demand increases.
If pressure fluxuates above and below spec, as EVRT™ is cycling, replace the turbocharger.
If disconnecting or cycling the turbocharger does not bring pressure below spec, continue with step 13.

step1.para: Do Test 19 (Relative Compression Test) to pin point suspect cylinders.
Do Test 18 (Injector Disable) to further pin point suspect cylinders.
Inspect air induction for dirt ingestion.
Measure compression with compression test adapter and gauge. Compare compression cylinder to cylinder.

item.para: Cylinder bores badly worn or scored
Leaking valve seals or worn valve guides
A restricted orifice in crankcase breather tool
Air compressor affecting crankcase pressure. Remove compressor discharge line to remove its influence.
